1.text: Pour a 3 ounces (85 g) box of gelatin powder into a bowl.

2.text: Add 1 cup (240 ml) of boiling water and stir until the powder dissolves.

3.text: Add 1 cup (240 ml) of cold water to the mix and stir for a few seconds.

4.text: Choose 3 or 4 types of fruit you want to use.

5.text: Avoid fresh pineapple, kiwi, mango, ginger root, papaya, figs or guava.

6.text: Wash your fruit and slice it into small pieces.

7.text: Layer your fruit in a bowl or Jello mold.

8.text: Make homemade vegan Jello if you are vegan or vegetarian.

9.text: Pour agar-agar, fruit juice, water, and sugar into a pot on the stove.

10.text: Boil the mixture for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.

11.text: Pour the Jello liquid mixture over the fruit.

12.text: Place the bowl in the fridge for 1.5 hours.

13.text: Turn the bowl upside down onto a plate.

14.text: Refrigerate your dessert until you are ready to serve it.
